qas.question: Approximately how many rufugees and asylum seekers are in Egypt?
How may Palestinian refugees are in Egypt?
How many recent Iraqi refugees are in Egypt?
What cities house several important Jewish archaelogical sites?

context: Egypt also hosts an unknown number of refugees and asylum seekers, estimated to be <a0_0>between 500,000 and 3 million<a0_0/>. There are some <a1_0>70,000<a1_0/> Palestinian refugees, and about <a2_0>150,000<a2_0/> recently arrived Iraqi refugees, but the number of the largest group, the Sudanese, is contested.[nb 1] The once-vibrant and ancient Greek and Jewish communities in Egypt have almost disappeared, with only a small number remaining in the country, but many Egyptian Jews visit on religious or other occasions and tourism. Several important Jewish archaeological and historical sites are found in <a3_0>Cairo, Alexandria and other cities<a3_0/>.
